page.title: 03Memories of a Gretna lady
page.content: When{World War 2}broke out{evacuees} came to{Gretna}from{Glasgow}.Homes were found for them using the A.R.P. canteen,behind the{school}and{Surrone {House},the staff being made up from various ladies organisations. Rangers,guides and even the young brownies adopted several local P.O.W's,paying for food parcels dispatched each month by the Red Cross. In the post war period the ownership of most of the shops has changed and the cinema has been converted to a bingo hall.The community centre has become the hub of most activites and houses a library and day centre for pensioners.The population has increased with many houses being built.
